title: Perdendo configurações manuais de proxy
content:
Uso um proxy para acessar os sistemas do trabalho, e para isso faço uso da "Configuração manual de proxy", no Firefox no Windows 11. Há alguns meses estou lidando com uma falha que não encontro solução: quase que diariamente, o Firefox perde as configurações manuais de proxy, retornando para a opção "Usar as configurações de proxy do sistema" e descartando os dados de proxy previamente configurados. Assim, tenho que novamente selecionar a opção manual e reinserir as informações de Proxy HTTP/HTTPS e Porta.

Já reinstalei, fiz reinstalação limpa (excluindo configurações e dados, e não configurando conta de sincronização), já removi a versão padrão e substituí pela versão beta, e nada deu solução. O Firefox continua perdendo as configurações.

Uso o Firefox como navegador padrão para o trabalho, enquanto uso o Chrome para uso pessoal, pois considero o Firefox mais estável e prático, mas estou até avaliando voltar a utilizar o Chrome para o trabalho, pois essa coisa de todo o dia ter que reconfigurar o proxy no Firefox já virou um transtorno.

Já mandei vários feedbacks para Mozilla, mas nunca obtive resposta.

Alguém mais se deparou com esse este problema? Encontraram a solução?
creator: patrickallendias

title: Javascript Not Functioning on Specific Web Pages (WITH ADDONS DISABLED)
content:
Noticed this issue about two months ago, specific webpages that are reliant on Javascript have stopped functioning properly. Either live timekeeping doesn't work (Solarham, SPC) or sections/functionality is completely missing (SPC doesn't show their side bars + clock, Mynoise will not play their sound generators)

My addons are NOT the problem here so please don't insist they are. I've completely disabled all of them multiple times since the issue first happened (including today) to check if that was the case with no luck. Disabled the secure browsing thingy for these pages, no fix there either. Reinstalled Firefox + refreshed it with no solution. Nothing relating to Javascript is disabled in settings. The only "real" fix I had was rebooting in troubleshoot mode or creating a new profile (which worked until something specific, other than an addon synced after I logged in)

Which brings me to the assumption that something is corrupted with my browser profile but now that its attached to my Mozilla account, I have no idea if I can still keep my bookmarks, logins, etc without losing them if I need to completely start from scratch.

Unsure if there's something new about Firefox that doesn't work with how specific sites write their Javascript or if my profile is truly corrupted.

I can provide troubleshooting information if needed with all of my addons off at a later time if it would be helpful but don't see a need yet for the initial post.

title: Unable to migrate Firefox settings and bookmarks from older Mac to new
content:
I am trying to migrate and update Firefox from my old Mac computer to my new one and preserve all my bookmarks, passwords, etc. I was originally advised to use an "about profiles" method to transfer that data to the new browser by selecting the desired signed-in version, and that seemed to work initially, but when I restarted my new computer today, it reverted to an older version of my bookmarks. Figuring I had conflicting preferences, I completed uninstalled Firefox on that new computer and re-installed a fresh download, however, now the "about profiles" method can no longer find the correct version of Firefox with the bookmarks I want (yes, I am still signed-in on that old computer).

It seems that syncing between computers may be one way to resolve this, however, how do I select the master version of the browser data on my old computer to protect and sync to the browser on my new computer whose data can be over-written ... I don't want to sync in the wrong direction e.g. have the fresh Firefox download without any bookmarks over-write my "reference" version already populated with bookmarks and passwords on my old computer. I am not finding any setting to designate the direction of the sync ... does such a setting exist?

If syncing is not the safest method to transfer the data, can I manually copy all the files and folders from my old computer to the new one, and if so, is there a list of where they all are?

Thanks!

title: FireFox takes 15 seconds to load first page
content:
When I startup FireFox, it takes ~15 seconds to show me an page. After loading, it works normal and loads pages within a second, until I completely close the browser, and then the first page again takes ~15 seconds. I've been having this issue for the past few months.

- I tried disabling all my addons - Launched FireFox in troubleshoot mode - Deleted everything in DataReporting\Archived folder - Cleaned out History/Cookies and site data/Temporary cached files and pages - Tried both Default and Max protection for DNS over HTTPS - FireFox is allowed in Windows Defender firewall - Tried setting 'browser.cache.disk.enable' to FALSE - Tried changing 'Enable HTTPS-Only Mode in all windows' to 'Don’t enable HTTPS-Only Mode' - Windows and FireFox are up-to-date

None of the above saw any improvement in loading time.

content:
I need some help with Firefox -- surfing the web has become excruciatingly slow. 

 Chrome and Edge don't have this problem -- but I don't like surfing with those  browsers -- and I like Firefox better. 
 When I click on a link, I see this message in the lower left: 
     "Connecting to ff.kis.v2.scr.kaspersky-labs.com.." 
 Of course, "kaspersky-labs.com" no longer exists, (for Americans).    Eventually, after several minutes, it times out and the web page I was  trying to access appears. 
 Kaspersky was trying to protect me by checking to see if the website I clicked   was a potential criminal enterprise or not. 
 I was a former customer of Kaspersky, but the U.S. Govt. has decided that we  cannot do business with Russian-based enterprises. 
 I tried doing an "Remove Programs"-->"Kaspersky" via Microsoft System,   Which removed Kaspersky from my system, but not from Firefox. 
 I also tried looking at the Firefox extensions, but there was no Kaspersky  extension.

title: How can I troubleshoot extensions that are not working in Firefox?
content: Tohttps://ressoapkpro.net/ troubleshoot extensions not working in Firefox, first, ensure that the extension is up to date by checking for updates in the "Add-ons Manager" (Ctrl+Shift+A). Next, restart Firefox to see if that resolves the issue. If the problem persists, disable other extensions to identify potential conflicts. You can also try starting Firefox in "Safe Mode" (without extensions) to check if the extension is causing the issue. Lastly, reinstall the extension or clear Firefox's cache to ensure proper functionality.

title: Technical problem
content:
Did Not Connect: Potential Security Issue

Firefox detected a potential security threat and did not continue to www.google.com because this website requires a secure connection.

What can you do about it?

www.google.com has a security policy called HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS), which means that Firefox can only connect to it securely. You can’t add an exception to visit this site.

The issue is most likely with the website, and there is nothing you can do to resolve it. You can notify the website’s administrator about the problem.

title: Desktop Firefox for macOS Javascript
content:
Desktop Firefox doesn't display Javascript confirm() messages when in Browser Tools > Responsive Design mode. I test for window width to determine if I'm on a mobile device and put up a confirm() if so, like this: 

   <script type="text/javascript">        window.onload = function () {            // Detect if the screen width is less than or equal to 768px (commonly used for mobile)            if (window.innerWidth <= 768) {                // Ask the user if they want to switch to the mobile version               x = confirm("You're on a mobile device. Switch to mobile-friendly schedule?");               if (x) {                    // Redirect to the mobile version if the user chooses to                    window.location.href = "daybytime.php"; // Replace with your mobile page or PHP script                } else {                    // User chose to stay on the desktop version, no action needed                    // Optionally, you could store this choice using cookies or localStorage                }            }        };    </script>

In Responsive Design Mode the "You're on a mobile device..." doesn't appear; the dialog appears but is blank. The Cancel and OK buttons function correctly. In regular mode and on other browsers, if I manually shrink the window the dialog appears and the buttons function correctly.

This page is at https://einfo.kulekats.com/calendar/index.php .

title: Why is there no option to clear data from 1hr ago or 7 days ago ?
content: Hi all. So I recall maybe a year or 2 or even 3 ago, i read an update that said Firefox browser supposedly now had option to delete browsing/form etc data with options like "delete data from 15 min ago, 1hr, 2 days, last 7 days," like Chrome has. I was excited about that, so that i didn't have to keep clearing all the data and places i was signed into after typing in personal info on a site. BUT to this day,I've still not seen that option. Did Firefox never actually come out with those options or?? What is the deal? I am on a pc. but i have it on my android phone as well, and don't see those options there either. What's the deal? Can someone offer some insight on this? Been using firefox for many years. thanks in advance.

title: Can I sync or restore Firefox data from a synced mobile device back to PC after PC Firefox deleted
content: Thanks to a Microsoft update my PC had to have Windows reinstalled causing me to lose all my apps. I have reinstalled Firefox on the PC but of course, all my bookmarks and passwords are missing. I had set up syncing between my PC and my Android mobile devices (phone and tablet). Can I restore or sync from the mobile device back to the PC? I have searched and found nothing. Even when signed into Firefox on the phone, it does not bring up "Sync" when I go to settings. I truly appreciate your help.

title: Firefox stopped working at my school
content:
the problem Recently in the last 2 weeks Firefox suddenly started giving errors whenever I went to any website (including any search engine). Except for my school portal that worked find. what I've tried to fix it I've tried messing with the settings and l've reinstalled Firefox three times but it didn't really help at all. additional information

  • If I use any other browser like safari then everything works fine.
  • Also just before the problem started I installed the Cloudflare 1.1.1.1 app, but I completely deleted it and the problem still persisted.
  • The problem only happens at school, at home in my home network everything works fine
  • I used Betterfox although I have tried it without Betterfox installed
  • The first time reinstalled Firefox and Betterfox I also signed up for Nextdns and set that un in system settings it still didn't work so I tried to remove it but I'm not certain it was removed.
  • Just this morning I logged into Firefox in my school and it worked but then I reinstalled Firefox again and it broke. I can't remember why I decided to do that.
  • When I use a vpn it seams to work but I would rather be able to connect to the internet without a vpn.
